Players can accumulate points during the play by:
 Getting the running total to 15 or 31 = 2 points
 Playing pairs = 2 points per unique pair
 Playing a run or straight (minimum 3 cards) = 1 point per card
 Playing the last card before running total is reset (a go)= 1 point
 All points during the play are added immediately

Scoring your hand during the show:
 Contains a Jack of the same suit as the discard
 Contains pairs = 2 points per unique pair
 Contains a run or straight (minimum 3 cards) = 1 point per card
 Contains a set of 15 = 2 points per unique set
 Contains a flush = 1 point per card
 (all four cards in starting hand must be a flush, the discard card can only add one point not complete the flush)
 
The game ends when any player reaches 121 points during the play or show.

Cribbage uses a standard deck of playing cards. At the start of the game, first dealer is chosen randomly and switches off every round. Dealer deals six cards to each person. Each player chooses four cards to keep and discards the remaining two to a separate hand called the crib.

Non-dealer plays the first card and play is alternated between the two. Cards are played until the running total is 31 or no player can play a card that puts the total over 31. If one player has no valid plays, the other player must continue until they also have no valid plays. When neither player can play any more cards, the running total is set back to zero and play resumes with the person who did not play last. Round continues until both players have no more cards.

In the show both players take back their cards and score it with an additional card cut from the deck that counts towards both player\'s hands. The non-dealer scores their hand first, then the dealer, and finally the dealer scores the crib start of the round.
